column5: I think that is what FRANKIE65 was saying, that it's not like facebook and he doesn't want to read someones tweet every time they fart or stop to buy a coffee..you don't get that on facebook
Not able to find you on Twitter, is there something wrong Tight Lines SBK
Follower there Too Tight Lines SBK
Yep, NPS is good...just added a few of you OFC'ers to my list of follows....  @the_1st_johnnyb
You got it Terry.
I'll let people figure out the river conditions all my themselves, lol.  No need to broadcast it.
i use twitter by my only twitter friends are hockey journalists, scouts, and agents.  it's how i keep ahead of the curve on my hockey obsession.
sign up for the OFC tournament, if we don't get 4 more then some of us can't participate! I think that was under 142, but seriously sign up!
Twitter is good for sports.  I find I have to get rid of most of the professional fishing crowd as all they do is shill incessantly.   I have kept the good ones like Shirley and a few others.
@amarkew
its a great way to follow sports and athletes....just watching the jays chirp each other is great entertainment!
Romero and Arencibia are pretty funny. It is certainly entertaining.
followed a bunch from this post. some of you are already following me
you should check out Jason Werth! Beardpower!
Thanks.  I will do that.
just got myself a twitter @SamRankinFishin...follow me and ill return the favour!
PURENEWF  following you guys
@JamieStothart - personal account @TackleStock - business account @wafishingteam -   account
Following you...of course haha  @rpnlipsfshnteam
Following you now...   Good idea btw for starting this thread...
@thefishdawg  its fun, great way to stay on top of things, mostly use it for fishing & sports updates
i use it for river updates and up to the minute updates from the TSN crew  @joebinsview

I don't post too much on here mainly due to a ton of great members that already post some great stuff, but I always stop by for a visit.  However, I do use twitter and post stuff about fishing, hockey, stock car racing and general banter.  @faci81  Happy New Year & Tight Lines!  -Frank
you aren't joking!  15 post's in total over that many years, wow!  not a shot at you, just noticed that's all.
@JamieStothart and @TackleStock
Cool, Thanks man. Lots to be posting soon. Including my new Last Cast Specials.  Conan O'Brien is a good one to follow if you like his sense of humour.
Sometimes I post live fishing reports on Twitter & Facebook, but don't expect GPS coordinates lol  @SurelyFishingTV
@marrex_mike
this was a good idea to start this conversation.. fellow anglers as followers is always good.
@HoffmanOutdoors  I post fishing reports, articles, lure trends and releases, contests (that I run), etc.  Feel free to follow.  Good Fishing,  Justin
followed
Just went through and updated some of you that I missed before. For the ones who have not seen this thread please add your twitter name there are a bunch of fellow OFC members there
@joeyfishing13
lmao! I just noticed this reply because it was bumped up
@jeffdabossplaya   spelt it wrong in my original post
THEstrome1
Oh GOD, please give me the strength to not ever to on twitter  face book is bad enough
DANG! Where's the Like button!!
Nope, Facebook is more than enough (sometimes too much)...don't really want to know every time someone brushes their teeth or goes to Tim Hortons.
twitter is nothing like facebook.  i thought it was like that too, but not at all.
@AndersDereski  awesome thread.  use it mainly for sport updates but am going to try to use it for on the water up dates as well.
wait let me check.....nope hell didnt freeze over
I'll go through & conect with everybody I can, maybe slowly but surely, Mostly Fishing/Outdoors related & my Sons Bands Tight Lines SBK     @spinnerbaitking

Any of you guys on Twitter?? Post up your name and ill follow.  I was never into it before, but i friend convinced me to sign up, and i was surprised as to how many fellow anglers was on there, and how much useful posts they put up. Loving it.  @jeffdabossplaya
Its better here i believe , no twitter or face book for me , perhapes other may .

i signed on twitter to see what it was like and to keep an eye on dave mercers tweets, but i got a number of people who want to follow me, some women, some men, and they all wanted to do sexual things with me. I guess they were trolling LOL  I only go on it once in a while now, I find it kinda hard to say anything in 140 characters.  @elhreporter
Danm...I musta signed up for the wrong twitter? Or i'm just not as good looking as you grt
I just started the twitter thing and don't really get it at all lol. @toccobender

Never thought about Twitter as an angling tool Boss.  Might be a reason for me to sign up.  I've just always seen it as a marketing / selling tool.  Everyone who tweets typically has an agenda of somekind, whether it's to promote themselves or their products or companies.  I'm not a huge fan right now.

Your right, there is alot of businesses and promotion on Twitter but once you do create an account, you can choose who you follow therefore controling what content you view.  It is actually a great tool for anglers.  @eTackle_ca

I've never liked (no pun intended) any of the so called social networks. But I guess when your goal is to get as many followers as you can, it has some marketing worth. I keep getting a mental image of sitting in a boat with fishing Bud saying "Hey I got 23 likes today, how many did you get?" Kinda makes me puke just a little.
already following you  getting first notification of the sales

either did i, but once i realized this ive been addicted. A lot of the pros are on there, and post news, tips, and articles. As well as businesses, who show new products and sales, etc.  And of course fellow anglers, who share fishing catches, tips, stories, etc.
@Grateful_Fisher
See Below... lol
I think the folks that would talk like that would be more likely to be trolling behind a computer then on the water.
activly post fishing reports @myotfishing
i'm on it but not much, cause I forgot my password...  HAHAHA  @GeoffW13
@slaclub  definetly is a great fishing tool
Oh sure I go there and it looks like OFC has blown up Twitter the site has Twitter is over capacity.
"Tweet me" just sounds wrong to another "fellow" angler.....
Tweeting is for the birds.
@fishinniagara

There we go @handlebarzlures  I have not done a lot with it but plan to change that in 2012. One thing I would like to do is post reports as the fishing day goes on but I don't have the smarts or smart phone for it  I tried to find everyone but there was a couple that I could not find if I had not added you please check for me.
@MHBEAR, not there much ....... have a tough time with tweet and retweet  Want some good tips and to follow Pro's and Am's alike try http://nationalprostaff.com/  I'm just a follower there .......

Not to steal a thread but this is also a useful tool for sports fans...I follow my Oilers get updates from morning skate line combo's to injury also almost up to the minute scores. TSN tweets all kinds of sport headlines,great when i'm out or at work  Anyway don't fear it try it so much useful info aside from the regular star gossip  @mflintoff

stalker...  LOL!  Mike, if you update your stock and fishing reports you WILL get followers!  Just make sure you get a smartphone so you can add pic's while out on the water.  just look at Dave (FOF) and Pete (TNB) as an example.
@thejunkfisher
